title: Actor Govinda among 40-star campaigners for municipal corporation polls for Shiv Sena
content: On January 15, political parties will contest in 29 MC covering 2,869 seats, and around 3.5 crore voters will participate in the exercise to appoint the public representatives

title: Thackerays join hands for a Mumbai that has changed beyond recognition
content: The Thackeray cousins invoked their grandfather and social reformist ‚ÄòPrabodhankar‚Äô Thackeray along with their respective fathers, to emphasise on the lineage of the family that had fought for the Marathi manoos, stressing on how this was under threat again

title: Yunus keen to improve ties with India, says adviser
content: Dhaka signals an effort to ease strain with New Delhi, stressing that economic decisions, including rice imports, will be driven by cost and national interest rather than politics

title: Uproar as Hindu group allegedly recited Hanuman Chalisa outside Bareilly church before Christmas
content: The Congress alleged that the right wing groups are intentionally trying to undermine religious freedom of minority communities

title: 'Decorative piece': After India slams razing of Hindu statue, Thailand offers explanation
content: Thailand defended demolishing a Vishnu statue near the Cambodian border, citing security and administration. India expressed strong disapproval, calling the act disrespectful to Hindu sentiments. Cambodia confirmed the statue was on its territory and condemned the destruction, amidst ongoing border clashes that have claimed numerous lives

title: 'I've a plan': Zia's son rolls through Dhaka in bulletproof bus; what he said about Hindus
content: Tarique Rahman, BNP's acting chairman, made a dramatic return to Bangladesh after 17 years in exile, stepping into a nation facing turmoil. He drew parallels between current political upheaval and the 1971 liberation struggle, declaring "I have a plan" for the country's future. His arrival is expected to significantly influence Bangladesh's internal politics and its relationship with India.

title: 'Hurt Hindu sentiments': Bajrang Dal stages protest outside Bareilly church; watch
content: Right-wing groups Bajrang Dal and Vishwa Hindu Parishad protested outside a Bareilly church on Christmas Eve, alleging objectionable portrayals of Hinduism.  Reciting the Hanuman Chalisa, they claimed Christmas events hurt Hindu sentiments. Police are investigating after the groups submitted a memorandum demanding action against alleged misleading depictions of religious conversion and Hindu society.

title: Odisha encounter: Top Maoist with Rs 1.2 crore bounty among 4 killed; arms seized
content: A significant blow to the Maoist insurgency occurred in Odisha's Kandhamal district as central committee member Ganesh Uike, with a Rs 1.2 crore bounty, was killed in an encounter. Security forces gunned down Uike and three associates in a forest, recovering weapons and ammunition.

title: US tech companies‚Äô reliance on Chinese batteries a problem? Pentagon concerned
content: America faces a critical challenge as both tech giants and the military grapple with heavy reliance on China for essential lithium-ion batteries. This dependency threatens national security, impacting AI development and modern weaponry. Efforts are underway to build a domestic battery industry, securing vital components and reducing foreign control.

title: 'Didn't want to miss ...': How B'luru techie plotted wife's murder; chilling details emerge
content: A 39-year-old bank manager was allegedly murdered by her estranged software engineer husband, Balamurugan, who had planned the killing for months. He reportedly procured an illegal pistol and carried a knife as a backup, later surrendering to police and showing no remorse. The couple had a troubled marriage marked by alleged abuse.

title: 'Don't comment, post views': Army issues policy on use of social media apps
content: The Army has unveiled new social media guidelines for its personnel. While platforms like Instagram and YouTube are restricted to viewing and information gathering, users can share unclassified general information on messaging apps like WhatsApp and Signal with known contacts. LinkedIn is permitted for professional networking and job seeking purposes only.

title: IndiGo cancels 67 flights; bad weather, operational reasons cited
content: IndiGo is dealing with another wave of disruptions, canceling 67 flights due to weather and operational issues, impacting key airports. This comes as the airline operates under DGCA scrutiny following earlier mass cancellations linked to new pilot rest rules. The aviation regulator's panel is investigating, with a report on IndiGo's operational woes expected soon.

title: US tightens H-1B rules: Lottery system scrapped; NASSCOM flags 'innovation' concerns
content: Nasscom, India's IT trade body, warns that a proposed shift in H-1B visa selection from a lottery to a salary-weighted system will harm US innovation and competitiveness. This change could disadvantage small businesses, research institutions, and early-career graduates, potentially weakening the vital pipeline of Indian talent crucial for US leadership in AI and reinforcing the Indo-US partnership.

title: VHT: Rohit stops young fan from touching his feet; video goes viral
content: Rohit Sharma won hearts after stopping a young fan from touching his feet following Mumbai‚Äôs Vijay Hazare Trophy opener. He then starred with the bat, smashing 155 off 94 balls as Mumbai beat Sikkim by eight wickets in Jaipur. Rohit‚Äôs knock included his fastest-ever List A century and ensured a dominant win.

title: H-1B in age of social media vetting: When tweets meet immigration rules for global talent
content: America‚Äôs H-1B visa process has picked up a new gatekeeper: your social media. A December 2025 State Department update asks H-1B applicants and H-4 dependants to keep their accounts public during visa processing, widening a review earlier used for student visas. For skilled workers, the shift is subtle but real‚Äîcredentials still matter, but so does your digital footprint, and how it might be read.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
content: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: Shreyas Iyer injury update: 31-yr-old has 1st batting session since injury
content: India's ODI vice-captain Shreyas Iyer has begun batting practice sessions post-injury in Mumbai, showing no discomfort. The 31-year-old is now heading to the BCCI Centre of Excellence in Bengaluru for further assessment. While a return date remains uncertain, Iyer is aiming for the Vijay Hazare Trophy, with clarity expected after assessment at the CoE.

title: MDMA, LSD, ecstasy pills: Woman techie & boyfriend held for selling high-end drugs
content: Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing arrested four individuals, including three alleged drug peddlers, in a drug network bust. Officials seized a significant quantity of drugs, including OG, MDMA, LSD blots, and ecstasy pills, valued at over Rs 3 lakh. The operation revealed a sophisticated network involving online procurement and cryptocurrency payments.

title: 'You don‚Äôt know me yet': Killers‚Äô chilling words before shooting Aligarh teacher; how events unfolded
content: A 45-year-old computer teacher, Rau Danish Ali, was fatally shot by two masked assailants on a two-wheeler while taking an evening walk on the AMU campus. The attackers fled the scene after firing at close range. Police are investigating the incident, with the family suggesting the victim may have known his attackers.

title: CBSE in 2025: A look back at the changes set to reshape board exams
content: CBSE will introduce wide-ranging reforms from the 2025‚Äì26 session, reshaping exams, curriculum, and student support. Class 10 board exams will become biannual from 2026, allowing score improvement. APAAR ID linkage is now mandatory for Classes 9‚Äì12. Exam fees have increased, while syllabi align with NCF 2023. New career guidance, mental health counselling models, and an AI-powered digital experience centre aim to reduce stress and modernise learning for students, parents, and schools nationwide and abroad too.

title: Political scorecard in 2025: Top 10 winners and losers of this year
content: 2025 saw political shifts with Nitish Kumar retaining power in Bihar and Siddaramaiah navigating a leadership tussle. While Nitin Nabin and Chirag Paswan rose, the Congress faced defeats and internal strife. Arvind Kejriwal's AAP lost Delhi, and Prashant Kishor's political venture faltered, highlighting power's dynamic nature.

title: 'Sir, we have to evacuate ... ': Gadkari recalls meeting Hamas leader before killing; what followed next
content: Union minister Nitin Gadkari recounted meeting Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh hours before his assassination in Tehran. Gadkari, was in Iran, attending presidential swearing-in, and was informed of Haniyeh's death early next morning. The incident highlighted the growing role of technology in modern conflict and national security.

title: Ashes 'drinking' row: 'I did exactly the same' ‚Äî former captain defends England players
content: England's Ashes tour faces off-field controversy after a mid-series break. Former captain Michael Vaughan urges restraint, stating the issue stems from cricket's ingrained drinking culture. He argues that players relaxing on days off often engage in similar behaviour. Vaughan believes this is a systemic problem across several cricketing nations, not an individual failing.

title: Rich Indians rush to transfer money abroad as rupee falls, banks expand regulations
content: Indian banks are intensifying scrutiny on overseas money transfers, demanding detailed proof of fund origins from individuals and businesses. This heightened caution, particularly for remittances from NRO accounts, arises amid the rupee's slide and increased customer urgency to move funds abroad, leading to compliance hurdles.

title: 'Chanukah' sign car set ablaze in Melbourne days after Bondi beach shooting
content: A car adorned with a "Happy Chanukah" sign was deliberately set ablaze in Melbourne, prompting an investigation into a potential antisemitic attack. While no injuries were reported, the incident has heightened fears within the Jewish community, following a recent mass shooting at a Hanukkah festival.

title: Candidates 2026: 'Praggnanandhaa is third favourite' - World No. 1 Carlsen
content: World No. 1 and five-time World Champion Magnus Carlsen has named Americans Hikaru Nakamura and Fabiano Caruana as favourites for the 2026 Candidates, with India‚Äôs R Praggnanandhaa as the third contender. Praggnanandhaa is the only Indian among eight players competing to challenge World Champion D Gukesh. The tournament starts on March 28 in Cyprus.

title: B'day outing turns nightmare: IT manager 'gang raped' in CEO‚Äôs car; survivor recall horror
content: A private IT company manager alleged gang-rape by her CEO and an executive's husband in a moving car after a company party. The survivor claims she was drugged and molested by the CEO and raped by the executive's husband while the executive head was present. All three accused have been detained for questioning.

title: VHT: 'I get fans' frustration, but‚Ä¶' - Ashwin explains why matches weren't televised
content: Fans' frustration over limited Vijay Hazare Trophy TV coverage is understandable, says Ravichandran Ashwin.  While stars like Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are lighting up the tournament with centuries, many matches remain unwatched. Ashwin explained that broadcasting schedules are set far in advance, making last-minute telecasts difficult despite the players' presence.

title: Fast food at train stations? Haldiram, WoW Momos & more plan setup at platforms
content: Fast-food giants like McDonald's and KFC are set to open outlets at Indian railway stations, with the first expected in 2026. This move aims to elevate passenger experience to airport standards, offering significant sales potential. Brands will secure five-year licenses through e-auctions, potentially boosting Indian Railways' non-fare revenue.

title: Dhurandhar box office: Ranveer Singh film crosses Rs 600 crore mark
content: Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar' continues its impressive box office run, crossing Rs 600 crore despite competition from 'Avatar Fire And Ash'. Meanwhile, Kartik Aaryan and Ananya Panday's 'Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri' faces a slow start with limited shows and dull advance bookings, indicating a challenging opening.

title: Who is Sebastian Telfair? Ex-NBA guard freed after prison stint with Diddy
content: Sebastian Telfair was released from federal prison after serving time for a probation violation linked to the NBA health care fraud case. The former Thunder guard served his sentence at Fort Dix, the same prison housing Sean ‚ÄúDiddy‚Äù Combs. Telfair spoke about Combs‚Äô mindset behind bars and is now shifting focus toward a return to basketball through Ice Cube‚Äôs Big3 league.

title: No baraats, no brides, no beginnings: Inside India's ‚ÄòHamlet of Bachelors‚Äô
content: Barwan Kalan, a remote Bihar village, is dubbed the "hamlet of bachelors" as lack of roads, water, and electricity has prevented marriages for over 50 years. Despite being near tourist spots, residents face isolation, with basic services like hospitals and schools miles away.

title: VHT: Applaud, but heed bigger picture - Suryavanshi exposes domestic cricket's imbalance
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi shattered List A records with a 190 off 84 balls, including the fastest 150, as Bihar posted a mammoth 574/6. This performance, alongside other centuries in the Vijay Hazare Trophy, highlights a growing concern over the competitive balance in domestic cricket, particularly with the inclusion of newer northeastern teams.

title: India to miss $1 trillion exports target? Exports struggle despite the FTA push
content: India's ambitious $1 trillion export target by FY26 appears out of reach, with weak global demand and protectionism hindering merchandise shipments. While services exports offer a cushion, trade deals with the US and EU could be crucial. Diversification is underway, but a shift towards higher-tech products is needed for sustained growth.

title: CAT 2025 results: 12 candidates score 100 percentile; 9 from non-engineering backgrounds
content: CAT 2025 results have been announced by IIM Kozhikode, with 12 candidates achieving a perfect 100 percentile. Of these, nine are from non-engineering backgrounds, reflecting academic diversity among top scorers. The exam saw participation from 2.58 lakh candidates, with a balanced gender and category-wise representation. Delhi emerged as the leading state among 100 percentile scorers. IIMs and 93 non-IIM institutions will now begin their admission shortlisting processes.

title: Bangladesh unrest: Ex-PM Zia‚Äôs son Tarique returns after 17 yrs in exile ‚Äî why it matters
content: Tarique Rahman, BNP's acting chief, returns to Bangladesh after 17 years in exile, poised to lead the party in upcoming elections. His return follows legal acquittals and amid a reshaped political landscape after Sheikh Hasina's ouster. Rahman's re-entry signals a significant shift, with the BNP now a frontrunner.

title: Income tax refund: Your refund may be delayed if revised return not filed by Dec 31
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department is stepping up scrutiny on tax returns, leading to delays in refunds for many taxpayers. A NUDGE campaign is urging taxpayers whose deduction or exemption claims have been deemed ineligibile.

title: A hidden Arctic world: Methane mounds and life found 3.6 km below the Greenland Sea
content: Scientists have found a unique geological and biological complex deep in the Greenland Sea.  Methane hydrate mounds, formed by trapped methane and ice, were discovered along the Molloy Ridge.  These mounds support chemosynthetic organisms, life that thrives without sunlight.  This discovery offers new insights into Arctic oceanography and methane stability.

title: From cars to foreign trips: Freebie fest peaks in Pune civic polls; experts warn of new trend
content: Political aspirants in Pune are escalating campaign strategies for local polls, offering high-value inducements like Paithani saris, vehicles, land plots, and even holiday trips. This shift from traditional outreach to extravagant giveaways signals a fiercely contested civic race driven by competition and a focus on visibility over ideology.

title: Karnataka crash: Fuel tanker jumped divider, hit bus head-on; how a split-second collision turned fatal
content: A horrific accident on NH-48 saw a fuel tanker collide with a sleeper bus, igniting a blaze that claimed at least nine lives. The tanker jumped the divider, engulfing the bus in flames and trapping passengers. Rescue efforts are ongoing, with the death toll expected to rise. The tanker driver perished, while some bus occupants escaped.

title: Understanding key difference between Greek yogurt and Indian dahi
content: Discover the key differences between Greek and regular yogurt, from production and texture to nutritional profiles. Greek yogurt, strained for thickness and protein, offers a tangy taste, while regular yogurt is smoother and slightly sweeter. Both boast probiotics for gut health, but Greek yogurt excels in protein and lower sugar, making it ideal for weight management and satiety.

title: 'Bauna' remark: 'Pant, Bumrah apologised' ‚Äî Bavuma says 'you don't forget what is said'
content: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma has revealed that Indian players Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant apologized for an on-field comment made during the first Test. Bavuma, initially unaware of the remark, stated that while such incidents are part of intense cricket, words spoken are not easily forgotten. He emphasized that despite the heated exchanges, mutual respect between players remained intact.

title: Hymns, carols, morning prayers: How PM Modi celebrated Christmas ‚Äî see pics, watch video
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi extended Christmas greetings, wishing for peace, compassion, and hope, and called for societal harmony. He attended a Christmas morning service at The Cathedral Church of the Redemption in Delhi, highlighting the enduring values of love and brotherhood. This follows his consistent engagement with the Christian community through various events.

title: Christmas miracle: Man slips from 10th floor; gets stuck on 8th floor window grill
content: A Surat man had a miraculous escape after falling from his 10th-floor apartment window and getting caught in an 8th-floor grill. Firefighters swiftly responded, cutting through the grill and using ropes to safely rescue the 57-year-old. He sustained injuries and was hospitalized following the dramatic incident.

title: 75+ Merry Christmas messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
content: Christmas offers a welcome pause, emphasizing connection, kindness, and genuine joy. This season's significance stems from its roots in hope and renewal, expanding to universal themes of togetherness and generosity. Thoughtful messages, whether for family, friends, or colleagues, carry deep emotion and foster meaningful connections.

title: Ashes: Ravi Shastri the next England coach? Ex-cricketer explains why he fits the bill
content: Following England's Ashes struggles, former spinner Monty Panesar has proposed Ravi Shastri as the next head coach. Panesar highlighted Shastri's success in leading India to back-to-back Border-Gavaskar Trophy wins in Australia, emphasising his understanding of how to conquer the hosts on their home turf. This suggestion comes as Brendon McCullum faces increasing pressure despite his initial impact.

title: Shimla doctor, who thrashed patient sacked; govt finds act 'unbecoming of a public servant'
content: Himachal Pradesh government has terminated the services of Dr. Raghav Nirula, a senior resident doctor at IGMC Shimla, for assaulting a patient. An inquiry committee found his actions unbecoming of a public servant, leading to his dismissal under the Resident Doctor Policy 2025. The incident involved a scuffle with a patient, and an FIR has been lodged.

title: In Tarique Rahman's 'I Have A Plan' Speech, An Ode To Martin Luther King
content: Bangladesh Nationalist Party's acting chairman Tarique Rahman, who is also the son of former President Ziaur Rahman and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, returned to Bangladesh on Thursday after 17 years in exile.

title: In Pics: A Look At Christmas Celebrations Across The World
content: Christmas is celebrated across the globe, but in distinct ways. On the occasion, people decorate their houses by putting a Christmas tree, illuminated paper star, Holly wreaths and exchange gifts.

title: Video: Clashes Between Rival Carol Groups In Kerala Leave Several Injured
content: Several people, including women and children, were injured after clashes broke out between two groups of Christmas carol singers in Kerala's Alappuzha district on Wednesday.

title: What Nawaz Sharif Told Atal Bihari Vajpayee After His Historic Lahore Speech
content: Former Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee travelled to Lahore in February 1999 aboard a bus from Amritsar, marking a rare moment of diplomatic solidarity and moving beyond years of hostility between India and Pakistan.

title: Sleeping Man Falls From 10th Floor, Avoids Death As Leg Gets Stuck In Grille
content: He was sleeping in his 10th-floor flat and turned, falling straight out of a window to what would have been certain death. Fortunately for him, his leg got stuck in the grille of a flat two floors down.

title: Madhya Pradesh Minister's "Fake Farmers" Swipe Draws Kamal Nath Response
content: Madhya Pradesh minister Vishwas Sarang has blamed the previous Kamal Nath-led Congress government's farm loan waiver scheme for the poor financial condition of cooperative societies and banks in the state.

title: 2 Men Force 13-Year-Old To Drink Alcohol, Then Rape Her In Delhi
content: Two men, including a bank employee, have been arrested for raping a 13-year-old girl after forcing her to drink alcohol in Delhi

title: Chaos At Tirumala's Alipiri Complex As Weekend Crowds Surge
content: A tense situation unfolded at the Alipiri Bhudevi Complex today as a massive influx of pilgrims, driven by the weekend holiday rush, led to a brief stampede-like situation in the queue lines.

title: In First Christmas Sermon, Pope Leo Decries Palestinians' Conditions In Gaza
content: Pope Leo decried conditions for Palestinians in Gaza in his Christmas sermon on Thursday, in an unusually direct appeal during what is normally a solemn, spiritual service on the day Christians across the globe celebrate the birth of Jesus.

title: Art Of The Deal: How Intel CEO Flipped Trump Attack To $5.7-Billion Lifeline
content: When Trump proposed that the US receive equity in exchange for giving Intel more CHIPS Act money Tan struck a deal.

title: In Pics: Bethlehem Holds First Christmas Celebrations After 2 Years Of Gaza War
content: Bethlehem, the historic city of Palestine, marked the first festive Christmas after two years of war in Gaza as thousands gathered at the Manger Square to on the festivity eve.

title: Tribe Names In ST Certificates Of Some Manipur Government Staff Don't Exist In Official List: RTI
content: The Scheduled Tribes (ST) certificates of some employees in Manipur government departments have names of tribes that do not exist in the state's official list of ST cleared by parliament, according to information obtained via the RTI Act.

title: On Christmas, Hanuman Chalisa Recitation At Park Right Across Church In Haryana
content: It's Christmas today. But in Haryana's Hisar, Bajrang Dal and Vishva Hindu Parishad, the Hindu right-wing organisations, have announced a mass recitation of Hanuman Chalisa at a popular city park right across the church.

title: "We Have One Wish": Zelensky Hopes For Putin's Death In Christmas Address
content: Without naming Russian President Vladimir Putin, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said, "Today, we all share one dream," adding, "And we have one wish for everyone: 'May he perish,' as everyone says to themselves."

title: 1 Teacher, 5 Simultaneous Classes: SIR Impact On Education In Madhya Pradesh
content: In Kheda Madhopur village of Agar Malwa district, a small two-room primary school has become a stark reflection of the crisis unfolding in Madhya Pradesh's education system.

title: Family Of 4 Found Dead In Liechtenstein, 1 Body Recovered In Switzerland
content: Police on Wednesday discovered the bodies of two men and two women believed to belong to a single family from Liechtenstein, authorities in the tiny Alpine principality said.

title: 2 Fake Matrimonial Call Centres Busted In Gwalior, 20 Women Detained
content: The Gwalior Crime Branch has busted two fake matrimonial call centres that were allegedly defrauding unmarried men across the country by luring them with fake photographs and false promises of marriage.

title: Top Maoist Ganesh Uike, With Rs 1.1 Crore Bounty, Among 6 Killed In Odisha
content: Security forces in Odisha neutralised a top Telugu Maoist commander on Thursday. Ganesh Uikey, 69, a high-ranking central committee member of the CPI (Maoist) and head of its Odisha operations was killed by teams of the BSF and the CRPF.

title: Analysis: Raj Thackeray's Inconsistent Politics And Its Fallout
content: Raj Thackeray has been a prominent figure in Maharashtra's political sphere for the last three decades. Known for his oratory skills, he often makes headlines during election seasons.

title: US Says Over Million More Documents Related To Epstein Under Review
content: The US Department of Justice said Wednesday that more than a million more documents potentially related to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein have been discovered and are being reviewed for release.

title: Points league rankings: Michael Porter Jr. vaults into top 20
content: the fantasy basketball head-to-head points league player rankings are updated regularly throughout the season based on player performances, injuries, trades, signings and other trends . he has moved up into the top-20 in the points rankings . his 25.6 PPG, 7.4 RPG and 3.3 APG would mark career highs for MPJ .

title: MVPs for every bowl game: Micah Alejado helps Hawai'i erase 21-point deficit
content: the 2025 bowl season is in full swing and college football experts are here to highlight the best performances from bowl season . we'll pick MVPs from each of the 36 bowl games from Dec. 13 to Jan. 2 . quarterback micah Alejado proved to be the best quarterback on the field Wednesday .

title: 'If I don‚Äôt get this right, my career is over': How Penn State landed on Matt Campbell as its next coach
content: Matt Campbell is new coach for the first time in 58 days as head coach . the 46-year-old had become Iowa State's all-time coaching wins leader . he had spent much of his childhood following Nittany Lions football while visiting grandparents .

title: NFL playoff-clinching scenarios: What's at stake for nine teams in Week 17?
content: eight more teams punched their ticket into the postseason during week 16 of 2025 . 10 of 14 teams have qualified for the playoffs with two weeks to go . five AFC teams and four NFC teams have a chance to secure something this week .

title: Doncic, Reaves and the hilarious bromance fueling the Lakers' wild start
content: the 8,000-sQUARE-FOOT Manhattan Beach mansion was designed with a minimalist motif . the five-bedroom home was built from tennis star Maria Sharapova . it features a premium man cave amenity that doubles as an irresistible lure for competition junkies .

title: Power Rankings: Kentucky, Seton Hall crack top 25
content: Kentucky dropped out of these Power Rankings back on Dec. 4 . the Wildcats lost by 35 points to Gonzaga in Nashville on tuesday . a complete roster looks very much like a top-25 team, if the second half is any indication .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: The 25 most college football moments of the 21st century
content: college football slips so easily into pure chaos after all the on-field heroics . college football is a celebration not of the sublime but of the ridiculous . it has to be a little bit weird, colorless, color-coded moment .

title: Hawai'i caps rally with last-minute TD to stun Cal
content: backup quarterback Luke Weaver threw a 22-yard touchdown pass to Nick Cenacle with 10 seconds left . weaver entered the game after Micah Alejado took a hard hit on the previous play . he led his program to its first nine-win season since 2019 .

title: Why believe in Tyler Shough, Malik Willis and other unlikely playoff starters?
content: a new year threatens to begin before you've processed the entirety of the one that you're still navigating . the month of December rolled out at an excruciating pace . there are a variety of pocketed countdown calendars replete with surprises like chocolates or crystals .
